website_summaries.verdict: The HP Scanjet G4050 is a solid scanner that could use a driver overhaul and a better means of handling slides.
pros: Excellent scans, especially of very saturated originals
cons: random color registration problems on slide scans

website_summaries.verdict: The HP Scanjet G4050 offers six-color scanning for excellent scan color and does a good job on both prints and film, including mounted slides.
pros: Six-color scanning yields excellent color quality
Can scan up to 16 slides at once
cons: Scan software is cumbersome in some ways and sometimes slow to react to a command

customer_reviews.title: Great Negative Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I came across a box of old negatives (from the 1930s and 40s). They are irregularly shaped and there were lots of them and I wanted a scanner that could not only scan odd shaped negatives, but lots of them. This scanner does an amazing job. The entire scanning bed can be used for negatives (verse just a small portion). A lot of the negative reviews on here are old and outdated. Sicne this scanner came out they have developed drivers and additionalsoftware to ensure it works. I used this on both MAC OSX 10.5 and 10.6. Any complaints? Not really - its bigger and bulkier than most scanners but then again, this is also a negative scanner.
customer_reviews.author: DaliDrama

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions first!
customer_reviews.text: I used this device to scan over 5,000 photos and countless slides. It is very well equipped for scanning slides but the photos take some experimentation. It took me awhile to figure out how best to scan several photos at once, but once I figured it out, it went very smoothly. I am not one to read directions, but rather just jump in to it. My suggestion is to read first, then jump in. You will save yourself much lost time. I would buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for 16 slides, poor sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version of this scanner that scanned 25,000 slides before it finally wore out. We purchased this new version. The new unit appeared to have a CCD with poor sensitivity, plus a light leak. Could barely scan 4 slides when specs said it would scan 16 like the older version. Sent unit back as faulty, but ordered another. The next unit had no light leaks, but still poor sensitiviy. Still would only do three or four slides even with updated software. HP tech support claimed that was just the way it worked, and nothing much they could do. Returned this unit, and are sending our slides to Costco to make DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: I was not disappointed! Not only did it pull out all of ...
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I ordered this scanner was that I hoped the technology had advanced enough that I could scan my parents wedding picture (a slide from 1946) and get more than a lot of dark with a few light spots. I was not disappointed! Not only did it pull out all of the colors but I can actually see the siding on the building behind them. Yes, it is still a little grainy but most of that can be corrected in a photo editing program.
customer_reviews.author: Brent M. Braten

customer_reviews.title: Versatile but low-quality scanner, NOT for Mac!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Handles all types and sizes of film (35mm, 120, slides, 4x5, etc) - Comes with several film adapters/ holders - Scans high density (2,400 DPI) - Cheap (~$120 used) Cons: - Mac OS software does NOT allow batch processes! - Color reproduction is oversaturated, greens shift towards red - Grayscale negatives are muted and low contrast - Scans notably softer than more expensive scanners
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Access is Denied
customer_reviews.text: Get used to seeing that message if you waste your money on this scanner. Just ended an hour long phone call with HP customer support trying to install the software on windows XP. They know about the problem. The installation package includes the "Access Denied Utility" which was ineffective on my system. They are researching the problem and promise to call call later. In the mean time I have an attractive $250 paper weight on my desk
customer_reviews.author: H. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Scanner, Vivid Color
customer_reviews.text: After two months of using the HP Scanjet G4050 I am still thrilled with the performance. Installation was flawless and user friendly. I have a Dell system running Windows XP. I scan original artwork which is highly detailed and vividly colored. The color rendered on the screen from the HP scans is fabulous. The HP scanning software is user-friendly with lots of options. You can divide a scan into separate files after one scan. The lid is flexible so that you can place thicker items on the screen. You can actually get a bit more of the document scanned than the specs state. Highly recommend this scanner. [Update 3 years after purchase: Scanner still works flawlessly, vivid color, great product.]
customer_reviews.author: PaperArtist

customer_reviews.title: Very slow with a buggy software
customer_reviews.text: It takes 30-60 minutes to scan 4x5" color slide (positive), and whole night to scan 20 negatives of 35mm film. The HP software reports that it needs more memory if you scan with the top available hardware resolution (4800 dpi) on the machine with 16 gigabytes of RAM. Requires both the device and the HP software to be restarted after each scan operation. The quality of the images is also not acceptable, especially with regards to the sharpness and color rendering. Do not buy this, it is like a bad joke, not a scanner!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Fedin

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but very nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my mother for Christmas. She said it was easy enough to set up but it does take up alot of space. Her passion is geneology and she shares pitures with family members via internet. She had some negatives of her mother who passed away before I was born. She had some of them restored years ago at photo store but we live in a very rural area and this just works better for us. It really is the best thing I have ever bought her.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D. Marcum

customer_reviews.title: HP ScanJet G4050.  Slow but good.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about 2 months. Initially the G4050 had problems with color tint. With help from HPs tech support, a newer copy of their software resolved the problem. HPs tech support is fairly easy to get to and they try to be helpful. Only negative of this product is that the scans runs slowly. A comment on their OCR software. Its the first time I've tried such software. It does a good job of creating text from the images.
customer_reviews.author: Mark BrandMunicipal S. Corp

customer_reviews.title: quieting the scanner- a good scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have used this scanner for about 3 weeks and did notice the slight noise from the gears. I removed the base and put "Sil-Glide" lube on the teeth of the three gears and the metal guide rod and excercised them and it quieted down by half. There was no lube on the plastic gears, but some helps. All functions seemed to work just fine on this scanner. I think it is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poor excuse for a scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to scan old 4x5 and other odd sized negatives. The 4x5's fall out of the holder, the 35mm holder won't take anything smaller, the 120/620 holder will not accept larger or longer negs. It is too slow, awkward to use, and the copies need a lot of editing due to poor contrast, etc. I would not recommend this copier to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Charles I. Davis

customer_reviews.title: and this unit is much better and higher quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older unit that died, and this unit is much better and higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: OK with some problems
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, the scans have excellent color reproduction and the images are sharp and crisp. On the negative side, at 200 dpi it tends to pick out every little flaw in photos; matte-finish photos have a large amount of "noise". Worst of all, my unit arrived with a foggy film on the underside of the scanner glass. HP has directions for cleaning the underside of the glass on their website and it was just a matter of wiping it down with a microfiber cloth, but one shouldn't have to take it apart and put it back together after just taking it out of the box for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Software doesn't load into my HP computer. I'm seeking help. Had two techs work over an hour each and couldn't load the software. HP said it was out of warranty three days after I received it and are still deciding whether or not to talk to me about it. Tried a third party software on a trial and it wouldn't scan negatives which is why I bought the scanner. I'm going to return it. RDK...
customer_reviews.author: R. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Mac Users avoid: Not Snow Leopard friendly
customer_reviews.text: The slide portion doesn't work for Mac Users, even after recent driver updates, it is a known issue on their forums. I was really hoping to use this for slides and that feature doesn't work at all on the Mac OS. TMA adapters could be better fitting and explained (manual is weak). The pictures have been fine in scan quality. A tip sheet would have been nice too, because some of it's features (Enhance Colors) over do it on recent color photos, but it worked fine for faded or old color photos. HP Support is non-existent, M-F 9-5 during the week only , without response to emails is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vail

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G4050 flatbed scanner, not up to par.
customer_reviews.text: Hp Scanjet G4050 flatbed scanner has problems recognizing picture on the scan bed. I have to add and crop each picture individually even though it is set up for multi scan. HP Quality isn't what it use to be. This Scanner is very disappointing, and customer support was dismal at best. I will look at other brand besides HP from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: great for negatives!
customer_reviews.text: does its job and handles all the negatives u can throw at it. pretty slow but that is the cost of a economy priced negative scanner. works great!
customer_reviews.author: rdiprima013

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Slides and Negitives
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the ability to do the oversized Negitives and when I receved it it is over my expectations other than if you don't start the next scan within 30 seconds or so it turns the bulb off and takes almost a minute to warm up again but when it scans it does a fast great job
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: If you need a bigger scanner that the ones that come on printers now then this is a really good one. I have been scanning slides and it is extremely efficient at this task. The software is good and works very easily. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Best Scanner I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Easy and Super fast. The colors are the most accurate I've ever seen. My only complaint is that it is just as loud as any other scanner.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: G 4050 easy to use with great results
customer_reviews.text: Without reading the instructions, this scanner is easy. I got great results. I bought this scanner to copy my thousands of slides. I have now copied over a thousand and the digital quality is better many times than the original slide. The software allows for adjustments for under light, over light, under saturated and better color rendition. A scan takes about a minute a slide for a 1 meg image. I experimented with negatives and that had good results too.
customer_reviews.author: Accidental Hipster

customer_reviews.title: Provided CD would not work with Windows 7, was ...
customer_reviews.text: Provided CD would not work with Windows 7, was able to install the drive after going to the HP web site, but could not install the HP Solutions Software.
customer_reviews.author: tsutton55

customer_reviews.title: scanner
customer_reviews.text: All works very well. Only issue is that it takes a long time for the scanner to boot up and start the initial scan. After the initial scan it moves rather quickly. This may be a software issues since I have plenty of RAM and I am using Win7 64 bit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: This is one great scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. It was not compatible with the Compaq laptop, but it works well with my husband's Acer laptop and my MacBook. My mother passed away recently, so I needed a scanner to preserve the photographs that I have inherited from her. This scanner has made preserving my mother's memories easy. The enhancement features that come with the scanner makes the photographs come to life.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy K Price

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Scanner, but poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is awesome and does 16 slides at once and they are very good. It does take some time, but worth it. The photo scanner is excellent. I had trouble loading in the HP Solution Center part of the program, but after 2 1/2 hours on the telephone with excellent help, it is now working great. There is no instruction book on the best size for slides, etc. and what the different settings do. I just called the help person in Canada and got the problem solved. I am now a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Excellant scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to scan slides from my many stacks of slides taken over many years. The scanner worked great and I was able to edit the slides with the software just fine. I would certainly recommend this scanner if you are looking to do work for your personal use and you don't want to spend a lot of money for the high end slide scanners. It is far superior to the cheaper units.
customer_reviews.author: nkplt

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet
customer_reviews.text: I think that this is a very serviceable unit. It was hard to find a good product that would work with a Mac, but this fit the bill. The pricing was attractive and it is very easy to use. It would be helpful to have a little more insight as to which setting should be used for various kinds of documents (is a signed agreement with a logo a text over image or an image over text?), but trial and error will overcome this lack of instruction.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with my first scanner
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Europe now with my Scanjet G4050/CN186AB0ZP. It has worked only in elementary fashion. It does not do OCR, it does not look up program updates. Its CD L1956-10025 "for Mac" says "you cannot open the HP Scanjet install.app because PowerPC apps are no longer supported." Each attempt of contact to HP leads into nowhere, "We are unable to locate the e-mail hp for product support." The website hp.com.at has disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Ewald Eichler

customer_reviews.title: Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a HP scanner and wanted to stay with HP because there were no problems. All features are good. Ease of use is good. I rated 3 stars for Mac use, longevity, and slides because I can't comment on those. I did have issues with installation of the software and getting some of the functions to work. I don't recall the exact error, but a google search of the error led me to the answer. HP on line help topics were useless.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: Bought to scan pictures from albums that were deteriorating. It has been preforming great, pictures and slides, and negatives. The software that came with it has been great also. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control at HP
customer_reviews.text: This product has issues and least of which is being able to work. I purchased a new unit but received a used unit. The install CD had a large scatch on it and I was not able to load the software. Amazon shipped a second unit which took me some time to install but at least it was a new unit. After spending 3 hours on the phone with HP help desk it was determined that the unit was broken. I would recommend another scanner before buying this unit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grewe

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for Slides
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned almost 1000 slides. This scanner is saving me $$$s. It does a great job and I can take my time sorting the slides and dating the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Because we liked the features and performance of our first one purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Because we liked the features and performance of our first one purchased in 2012, we purchased a second unit for a spare. This new unit was fully tested for functions and passed before storing. We plan on rotating use between the older and new unit in our commercial business.
customer_reviews.author: GS Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! As advertised and I would recommend it to others. The set up and install was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: TravisM

customer_reviews.title: Use it frequently.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Would like to see some changes in the software, but that is something I need to work out with HP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner for a little over 2 weeks and find that it meets all of my needs. It is much quieter than my previous 2004 HP scanner. It did take a little while to figure out how the controls on top of the scanner worked, but once I did, it was easy to do a scan. I got it mainly so that I could do copies of 35mm slides and it is doing a good job with those. I am happy with this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D. Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: My scanjet G4050 review.
customer_reviews.text: This machine serves me very well. I only have one problem with it. The image on-screen is not very well defined or I am not doing something right. Overall, it's fantastic. Worked fine, right out of the box.If anyone out there knows how to fine tune the image on-screen, how about shooting me a line or two, and share your knowledge with me about my issue. Dr. Love
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Love

customer_reviews.title: BJ
customer_reviews.text: I have used it many different ways. I love the way, it scans the slides, also the number the it does at one time. The fact, it puts each in its own file, is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: BJohn 1

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the HP Scanjet G4050 to convert over 1000 slides to digital photos on a MAC. The purchase was well worth it. It was capable of scanning 16 slides to good quality in around 15 minutes. I did attempt to increase the quality, but it took significantly longer with little improvement. This scanner is a good bargin for those who want to scan slides for home use.
customer_reviews.author: FTPugliese

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanner Problems
customer_reviews.text: I received the scanner in a timely manner, in good condition. The software was easy to use and hookup instructions simple and clear. Unfortunately, the scanner would not work. After following the "problem" guidelines, I finally called in a professional computer tech. After three hours, we gave up and the scanner was returned. The company was very helpful with the return. No idea why it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Victor C. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Up and running in 20 minutes on a Vista computer.I am completely satisfied with tho photo scans that I have made so far and have recommended this to some friends who are looking for a scanner to scan old pictures. EDIT 01/2011: HP has yet to come out with windows 7 support. Now that all of my computers are running win7, I own a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works well with Windows 7. The box came with wear showing but the scanner was 100% OK.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Houston H. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Works Well but is Slow and Noisy.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part the scanner performs well. The software provides a lot of options and the scanned images are clear and print well. However, the scanner is slow to start up and the actual scan motion is noisy.
customer_reviews.author: gsi10

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for slides
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased an Ion slide to PC product and it was worthless... only did one slide at a time, it was difficult to use, extremely slow and very poor quality. So bought the HP Scanjet G4050 and it does slides like a champ. East to use, takes about 12 minutes total time for 16 slides and quality is very good. Have not tried do do any photos yet so can't rate that but sure recommend for slides.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Stoffer

customer_reviews.title: photo slide scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment. Have scanned 1500 slides and 500 photos, so far. Takes practice, but worth it. 16 slides take about 9 minutes to scan, plus set up time. Turn around time total 20 minutes. HP photo premier software is not perfect, but workable.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Durante

customer_reviews.title: great scanner
customer_reviews.text: we use it for our business and are very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: jill of all trades

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanner program the worst.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought TWO of these scanners. On both occasions (at home and at work) the HP scanning program that came with the scanner failed to work. I got the scanners to work only after using an outside scanning program. The scanners are great once you get them going. The HP site was no help at all though.
customer_reviews.author: George H

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner
customer_reviews.text: It has been awhile and Still works just fine (2009) Good color easy to use I am glad I bought it. It does a lot of slides at one time.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: HP G4050
customer_reviews.text: I've had only good vibes with this unit. I use it mostly as a document copier. My daughter used it near steady for a 2 and a half days over labor day weekend scanning my wifes old family photos to a CD. Its much quicker and easier to use than the ancient magnavox scanner I used to have, and haven't been able to use for 10 plus years. ZNREL
customer_reviews.author: Zona Fritz

customer_reviews.title: HP  L1957A#B1H Scanjet G4050 Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This product has proved to be of quality, precision, it has a proper instruction manual and support programs to get the most out of the scan of my photographs.
customer_reviews.author: RAMON FRANCO TOPETE

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G4050 review
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is slower than I expected. The sharpness is great and I am glad I can scan 16 slides at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Rawn A. Wallgren

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to use 3rd party software. Adequate for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: KEK

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful!
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, but not supported under OS El Capitan! HP said to be working on a new driver.
customer_reviews.author: Incredulous

customer_reviews.title: This scanner met our expectations.l
customer_reviews.text: After getting some help from HP on set up our scanner is working well. So far we have only done slides, but plan to do all sorts of pictures as we feel that is the safest way to store them.
customer_reviews.author: Bethd

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: There was a setup glitch, but HP customer chat fixed it. It's a bit slow, but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Gita Smith

customer_reviews.title: Slide Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this scanner for the purpose of scanning slides. This model handles 16 35mm slides at a time and once you have your settings configured, is quite easy to use. Everything worked right out of the box, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mauldin

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: Just received the scanner this week, but I've already used it for scanning printed pictures and the color rendition is great. Its a little slow at scanning (seems to be the software, not the hardware). The vendor I purchased from was also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Medinger

customer_reviews.title: Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: This is a good machine as long as you do not use Omni Page or Paper Port. The software that comes with the G4050 over rides both of these programs with the opening page of the software provided by the manufacturer. I even tried to uninstall the software but its a part of the driver. I finally returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carden

customer_reviews.title: Works as mentioned
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works well, and is relatively quick. After a lengthy install and a bit of a learning curve (how to scan negatives) all went well. PQ is very good, and negatives come out very accurate. Good product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wrzesinski

customer_reviews.title: good scanner
customer_reviews.text: an excellent scanner with impressive results right out of the box I connected this to a Vista 64 machne with little effort and was up and running in under 30 minutes I would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Randall Trent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner for the price. Fast and very clear scans.
customer_reviews.author: Billy James

customer_reviews.title: Poor service
customer_reviews.text: The scanner arrived and appears to be of good quality, but shipped without the template needed to scan slides. Since my company bought this machine solely to scan our slide collection, this renders the scanner useless to us. Contacting the seller proved fruitless, as their policy is that if you do not notice missing or damaged items within two days of arrival, they will not solve the problem. I will never buy from this seller again, and I urge you to do likewise. There are better sellers out there that deserve our business. Update! I contacted HP customer service about the issue, and they are sending the part, since the machine is well under warranty. Thanks HP!
customer_reviews.author: Greenbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the software needed
customer_reviews.text: Software works almost great; but in doing more than one picture; won't do them individually. Even though it says it will. Scanner is so so.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Finfrock

customer_reviews.title: Photo Scanning
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scanner I have ever owned and the price was great to. Only problem with it is the scanner is a little slow, but it scans photos and documents better than anything I haave ever had.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is very large, it takes a lot of desk space. I use it to scan three dimensional objects and it does a good job. I do not use it for scanning negatives.
customer_reviews.author: G. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not Vista compatable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the G4950 from Amazon at the recomendation of HP since HP no longer supports their other scanners in XP. This scanner will not work with Vista. I have been on the phone and online with Hp 4 times in one week and the scanner will not work properly. I am sending it back to Amazon. BEWARE OF VISTA AND HP.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is so much nicer than the one I previously had. I love all the extra features, like being able to scan and print with one simple push of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vanderpool

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G4050 scanner
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with a power cord that didn't fit. The product was advertised as being able to scan multiple slides/negatives, but the needed templates were not included. The software was also not included. I spoke with the seller and was very pleased with their quick response. They were extremely nice and told me to return the product for a full refund. I would have been willing to keep it if I could have obtained some templates for the slide/negative scans, but was unable to locate any. While it was very inconvenient for me I was very pleased with the seller's response to the problem and would shop with that seller again.
customer_reviews.author: hendr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, easy to use, great quality scans. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: John Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Scanner does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now. It's slow to warm up, but it does what I need. It took me a while to figure out how to operate it, but for the simple need I have (photos and documents) it works adequately. I always use the 'preview' mode to check out what I'm going to get.
customer_reviews.author: Merrily

customer_reviews.title: great for a big slide transfer job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner because we wanted to convert all of our slides, from the last 40 years, into digital images. Being able to scan 16 slides at one time is really moving the project along. The image quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gaub

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I have over 3000 pics and documents to scan and this Scanjet is doing the job. The pics are clear and the machine is easy to use. I'm glad I bought this one. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: Had an older model but lost it in the Sandy storm. This unit is quicker & easier to use, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Verified Purchase HP Scanjet G4050
customer_reviews.text: I found this scanner installs almost mindlessly and is also very simple to use. I was, however, surprised at the size - I thought it might have been a little more compact. Overall the performance is quite satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: bahamablue842

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Have had absolutely so problems using this scanner. All my photos have been extremely sharp. The color is great to. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Need a negative scanner?  This is it.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding buy. It works like a charm. The propriety software needs a little work.
customer_reviews.author: X-man

customer_reviews.title: Scanner is very good!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner does beautiful work! The only thing I can complain about is the TMA adapter. I can't figure out how they want you to use it.. I found it very difficult to use for scanning slides. There probably is a way to use it; so I will have to call HP to find out how to use it. In the mean time I am using a TMA from my last HP scanner for slides. If you don't have an old TMA adapter, it is a big deal if you want to scan slides. DB
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Braun

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother if you use Windows Vista Software
customer_reviews.text: Beware of HP products and Windows Vista!!! HP is slow to provide drivers and software for Windows Vista users, of course they blame Microsoft. However, the don't hesitate to ship their pc's with Windows Vista. The software that comes with the machine will not load under Vista; they have only a minimal patch available. The full functions (six color scan, slides, and negatives) of the scanner are rendered useless. Of course they can't tell you when they will have drivers and full function software available. And it is not just this HP product; they have very few drivers for Vista ready and its four months after the release.
customer_reviews.author: K Town 2k

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: best service ever. delivery was next day when only the slowest "free shipping" was selected. Item was everything it stated and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan/Karey M.

customer_reviews.title: a great scanner
customer_reviews.text: this scanner covers 'em all. prints, negatives (35mm and medium format)and slides. The results are terrific but depends on your original product. It is not magic. It will not make a good print from a poor negative but it will allow you to make a less than perfect neg into a usuable one.
customer_reviews.author: George B. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Bad software
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner because it was supposed to be compatible with my new Apple. I am a photographer and develop and scan my own film. Not only was it not compatible, but HP does not yet have the necessary downloads to update the driver to run it. I ended up having to pay to download another program to make this work... The scans are wonderful now that I downloaded the other program, but I am seriously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Khru

customer_reviews.title: Slide Monster
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job on Slides - that's why I purchased it. Software is good.
customer_reviews.author: dew

customer_reviews.title: Always the best products
customer_reviews.text: I am never unhappy with the HP scanners. They are always up for my challenges, and they never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow0

customer_reviews.title: Fantanstic
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is fantastic. The set up was easy, and works just as advertised. I have not done any high level scanning, but it works great for pictures and for slides!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stefanowski

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived, had obviously been opened. No power ...
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived, had obviously been opened. No power cord, no instructions, no CD Rom. I immediately returned it via UPS. I really appreciated the ability to print out the label and attach to the container for shipment. I shall reorder the same product and hope it arrives intact.
customer_reviews.author: H. Thomas Wiegert

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: THE INFO AVAILABLE FOR THE USER IS NOT CURRENT FOR WINDOWS 7. WHEN TRYING TO GET HP SUPPORT YOU WIND UP WITH SOMEONE FROM INDIA THAT IS NOT FAMILIAR WITH THESE UNITS. LEAVES YOU UP TO TRIAL AND ERROR TO FIND OUT WHY THE FEATURES ARE NOT WORKING.
customer_reviews.author: DISAPPOINTED

customer_reviews.title: HP Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Color of scans was too saturated and unrealistic when compared with comparable scans and original slides. Software is quite user unfriendly. Scan speed unacceptably slow for adequate resolution of medium format positives. Did not live up to specifications and fell far short of expectations, so it was returned immediately. I am very disappointed in this product and it does not seem to live up to usual HP standards.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: tHEY DID NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I WAS NEVER ABLE TO GET THEM TO WORK .i HAVE A LOT OF x1O ITEMS THAT DO WORK WELL.NOW
customer_reviews.author: Bayard Badenhausen

customer_reviews.title: HP Scanjet G5040
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to get the scanner to work. We have had it for over a month but its been almost useless. Too time consuming to take the trouble. I have other products by HP that work without the frustrations. What should I do? GG
customer_reviews.author: George Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great Paper Weight
customer_reviews.text: This Scanner is a pile of #%$@!. It's as slow as molasses and the quality of the scans are like a $20 digital camera. It is definitely NOT for professionals or for those who value great images.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfish

product_meta.title: HP  L1957A#B1H Scanjet G4050 Photo Scanner
product_meta.description:
HP SCANJET G4050 Flatbed Photo Scanner. The HP Scanjet G4050 Photo Scanner provides breakthrough innovation with 6 colour/96 bit scanning for photos, slides and negatives which gives outstanding colour accuracy in scanning and reproduction, plus a transparent materials adapter that can hold up to sixteen 35mm slides or 30 negative frames for scanning of multiple images. The HP Scanjet G4050 features HP Real Life technologies for professional hardware dust and scratch removal, faded colour restoration and automatic red eye removal, allowing users to easily restore valuable memories. Four one touch task buttons, along with included HP Photosmart software and HP Photosmart Share, make it easy to restore, enhance and share photos.

AMAZON.COM
Designed to quickly and easily preserve precious memories, HP's ScanJet G4050 Photo Scanner lets you scan slides, negatives, and photos with superior color accuracy. Capture realistic color with high-definition photo and film scanning through HP's exclusive 96-bit scanning. Enjoy high-definition scans with 4,800 x 9,600 dpi resolution and preserve crisp text in scanned documents. The device comes with built-in dust and scratch removal tools, and you can edit text from scanned documents and magazines. Scan up to 16 35mm slides or 30 negative frames at once and bring old or damaged photos back to life by restoring faded colors. Superior color accuracy, high-definition scans with 4800 x 9600 dpi, and speedy previews (as fast as 8.5 seconds) are easily achieved with the G4050. Compatible with Microsoft Windows 2000; Windows XP Home; Windows XP Professional; XP Professional x64; Microsoft Windows XP Media Center; Mac OS X v 10.3.9; Mac OS X v 10.4 or higher, the scanner is backed by a 1-year manufacturer's limited warranty. Weighing in at just over 11.5 pounds, the scanner measures 20 x 11.93 x 4.25 inches. What's in the Box? HP Scanjet G4050 photo scanner, template kit, USB cable, power supply adapter/power cords, software and User's Guide CDs, Setup and Support Guide, and I.R.I.S. registration flyer
